intro: Seseli rubellum, commonly known as redstem seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia. The plant features slender stems that are often tinged with a reddish hue, giving it its common name. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Seseli rubellum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in open, sunny habitats.
